intro: Spermacoce graniticola, commonly known as the granite spurge, is a flowering plant native to rocky habitats in tropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found growing on rock outcrops. Due to its unique adaptations to harsh environments, it is of interest to botanists studying plant resilience.
